data.title: 键入缺少的字母，完成下面的文字

That ____ was ____ its ____ expression ____ popularized ____ Dior's ____, Yves Saint Laurent, ____ his Trapeze Line ____ Spring 1958, ____ featured ____ flaring ____ dramatically ____ a ____ shoulder ____. A-line clothes remained popular in the 1960s and 70s.
data.partBlankContent: Although an A-shape, this silhouette was not identical to what is now understood to embody the A-line idea. That id__ was gi___ its defin_____ expression a__ popularized b_ Dior's succ_____, Yves Saint Laurent, wi__ his Trapeze Line o_ Spring 1958, wh___ featured dre____ flaring o__ dramatically fr__ a fit___ shoulder li__. A-line clothes remained popular in the 1960s and 70s.
data.fullContent: Although an A-shape, this silhouette was not identical to what is now understood to embody the A-line idea. That idea was given its definitive expression and popularized by Dior's successor, Yves Saint Laurent, with his Trapeze Line of Spring 1958, which featured dresses flaring out dramatically from a fitted shoulder line. A-line clothes remained popular in the 1960s and 70s.
data.answer: 虽然是a型，但这个轮廓与我们现在所理解的体现a线概念的轮廓并不相同。迪奥的继任者伊夫·圣·洛朗(Yves Saint Laurent)在1958年春夏设计的“空中飞人”(Trapeze)系列让这一理念得到了明确的表达，并得到了推广。该系列的特色是连衣裙从一条合身的肩线上戏剧性地凸显出来。a字型服装在20世纪60年代和70年代仍然很流行。
